citation.article-title: Chitinimonas koreensis sp. nov., isolated from greenhouse soil in Korea
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Chitinimonas koreensis sp. nov.
Chitinimonas koreensis (ko.re.en′sis. N.L. fem. adj. koreensis of Korea, where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative rods, motile by a single flagellum.
Colonies are irregular, and no diffusible pigments are produced.
Growth occurs at 10–40 °C, 0–1 % NaCl and pH 5–8.
Positive for catalase and oxidase, and hydrolysis of casein, chitin, gelatin, tyrosine and starch.
Negative for hydrolysis of DNA, carboxymethylcellulose and urea.
Other phenotypic properties are listed in Table 1.
Ubiquinone-8 (Q-8) is the only respiratory lipoquinone.
Major fatty acids are summed feature 3 (C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH) and C16 : 0.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA is 65 mol%.
The type strain, R2A43-10T (=KACC 11467T=DSM 17726T), was isolated from greenhouse soil cultivated with cucumber in Sangju Province, Korea.
